ygData.subject: RE: Monks role:
ygData.msgSnippet: The quest is more difficult than a 10 hour spawn. I think I have a total of 110 hours now, for this particular spawn. I have camped for the last 3 weeks,
ygData.messageBody:
The quest is more difficult than a 10 hour spawn. I think I have a total of
110 hours now, for this particular spawn. I have camped for the last 3
weeks, logging from work and from home every 70 minutes. He spawned twice
after I had to stop. I wish it was a 10 hour spawn !!!!!!

Tsin Suchiko
38th rank, Tunare.


-----Original Message-----
From: imari_dellimore@... [mailto:imari_dellimore@...]
Sent: Thursday, January 20, 2000 6:25 AM
To: RaceFace; EQ-Monks@onelist.com
Subject: [EQ-Monks] Monks role:


From: imari_dellimore@...

A snaring glove or 1h blunt weapon would be an unlikely development. Monks
role
in a group is to do massive melee damge (reducing the load on the casters
mana
at high levels). To give us snare would weaken the ranger/druid role from
the
group some. Snare would be AWSOME, but it would mean we monks become to
powerful. able to solo in dungeons and area we were never meant to solo.

While on the subject of monk items:
I have a question for all of you who did the treant fist quest.
I have spent about 15hours (total in two marathon sessions) camping for the
humorous handheld mace off the alchemist in the Xorb gorge. I have killed
the
two goblin guards there till I am blue in the face. Nothing has made that
alchemist spawn. Is there a trick to doing so? Last night I spent about 10
hours at it (and I picked up the camp from a guy who had been there for 4
hours
before me and had to go to bed) So if you think about it in 14 hours of
non-stop camping he never showed. Anyone who has done the quest can help me
out
with some advice? I thought this guy was a 8-10 hour spawn?


____________________Reply Separator____________________
Subject: Re: [EQ-Monks] Patch day is this wednesday!
Author: "RaceFace" <bean@...>
Date: 01/18/2000 8:04 PM

From: "RaceFace" <bean@...>

Snare would be great. Stun would be nice too.

Perhaps ones that proc some sort of flame-based or force-based DoT. "target
is slammed by an intense force" or something like that. Think of it as the
monk focussing his ki into an attack.

-Raean Bloodyhands, 24th monk, Tunare.

> From: "Dizzy J." <dizzyj@...>
> for fun, what would you want something to proc? personally, I really wish
> I had a good mid lvl set of gloves that proced snare. most usefull spell
> in the game imho. then I could solo in dungeons that most people dont go
> into..upper guk, runnyeye, sola..etc.
